column1: Name
1 1/2 tbsp Basil, dried
1 14 ounce cans Chickpeas
1 14 ounce can Coconut milk, full-fat
1 14 oz block firm tofu (must be firm or extra firm, not soft)
2 Tbsp cornstarch
3 Tbsp unsalted peanut butter (creamy not crunchy- unsalted is very important or sauce will be too salty)
1–2 Tbsp water (optional- I prefer for a thinner sauce)
2 large eggplants, sliced lengthwise into 1/4 inch-thick slices, end slices discarded
Private Reserve extra virgin olive oil
1 pound flank steak sliced into 1/4 inch thick strips
1 jalapeño seeded and diced
1/2 cup brown sugar
2 packets active dry yeast (two 1/4 ounce envelopes)
8 Tbsp. butter, room temperature (cut into 1 inch pieces)
4 1/2 cup unbleached all-purpose flour (may need more as mixing)
3 cups flour (Either spelt or unbleached all-purpose or a combination of both)
1/4 cup butter, ghee, or coconut oil (I decided to use ghee for my frosting this time, and it gave it a nice, slightly caramel flavor.)
1 Coffee brown sugar rub
1 lb ground hamburger 80% lean
2 tablespoons olive oil or 1/4 cup water
2 cans (14oz.) lentils (or 3 cups cooked), drained and rinsed
2 1/2 lbs. potatoes (yukon or russet), cut into 1 inch cubes
salt + fresh cracked pepper, to taste
1 Salt and pepper
1/2 cup Parsley or cilantro, fresh leaves
